Leicester City fans jailed after Madrid violence, reports Spanish press By danjmartin | Posted: April 14, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Police observe Leicester fans in Madrid Leicester City fans jailed after Madrid violence, reports Spanish press X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 2 
Leicester City fans have been jailed for their part in violence before this week's Champions' League quarter final against Atletico Madrid, according reports in the Spanish media. 
Spanish football website Marca has reported eight Leicester fans appeared in court after being arrested following clashes with riot police in the Spanish capital's capital's Plaza Mayor. 
Read more: Leicester City FC seeks answers over police behaviour in Madrid 
The website says a judge has given four month sentences to offenders who were found guilty of getting involved in altercations with police. 
The fans are not named in the report but it adds: "Some of their number have been hit with six month jail terms because they actually hurt the officers." 
Read more: Russian Embassy weighs into row over Leicester City fans in Madrid with bizarre 'massacre' tweet 
Large numbers of Leicester fans gathered in the square to drink ahead of the 1-0 defeat by Atletico and a minority of them were recorded singing provocative Second World War songs and chanting about Brexit and Gibraltar. 
However some city fans have accused the Spanish police of being heavy handed and indiscriminate in the way they dealt with the unfolding situation with innocent supporters caught up baton charges. Footage of one fan being arrested in Madrid. It isn't known what happened to him 
The Mercury has asked the Foreign Office for information on the current status of the fans.
